I'm so happy to be here my name is
Jazmin Lawrence and I'm an engineer and
an entrepreneur I know this session was
called cool jobs and that that kind of
works for me in the plural because I do
wear a lot of hats and I have a lot of
jobs anyone with multiple jobs in the
audience right now yeah it's a struggle
but yeah I'll tell you how it got
started and I'll share a little bit
about the career paths that I've chosen
for myself so for me when I was a kid I
loved math and science but I also loved
art and building things I was very
creative and very you know curious about
how things worked I also loved watching
sci-fi movies any sci-fi nerds in their
Trekkies in the house yeah so for me I
loved watching these movies because they
showed me what the future could look
like and as a kid you know they would
ask you what do you want to be when you
grow up and the answers are a doctor or
lawyer kind of everyday things that kind
of holds society together but I wasn't
concerned with like what was happening
right now I wanted to build the future
where we're living on Mars or flying
through outer space so when I saw this
movie called Bicentennial man about a
robot that spent 200 years becoming
human I was hooked and I was like yeah
that's gonna be my job I'm gonna build
that I'm gonna be the person who builds
the arms and the brain and and like
really helps bring robots into our homes
and into our jobs in a way that's
actually useful so I started studying
math and science at a higher level and
and really engineering in high school
there are lots of programs in my local
high school was fortunate enough where
we could study robots and the basics of
physics and things like that and I went
on to study computer science at the
Georgia Institute of Technology in
Atlanta Georgia and there maybe I was
just turned 18 it was the first time I
learned how to code I learned how to
speak the same language that the devices
spoke I learned how to put transistors
together and put parts together and
actually build my own robot it was an
amazing opportunity at the school we
worked with
that were actually nurses and robots
that would dance with humans for
physical therapy and really kind of be
or your partner and wouldn't get bored
like a normal person would but it was
exhilarating for me to finally be be
able to do it so so soon only ten years
after seeing the movie and I was really
so passionate about building the
technology if what I learned was missing
from my life was how do you actually
build technology that actually works
with people right because the whole fear
about robots is oh they're gonna take
all the jobs that we love doing but my
focus is on social robots that
collaborate with you and work together
with you to support you and doing what
you need to do and so I went on to get
my master's degree in human centered
design and engineering so very focused
on understanding people the power
structures that they work in though the
places that they live the challenges
that they face in their everyday life
and figuring out is there a way that
technology could come alongside and
support them so after graduating from
all of that school poof I get a job
where I had multiple video game consoles
at my desk every day that's right I had
the opportunity to work at Microsoft
building their brand new Xbox one so
after eight years of school I basically
got paid to play video games every day
to build a community and a system and a
platform well bring people together to
do something they love so that's one way
where I saw technology connecting people
in a very fun way and it was also a
smart device so all of my learning had a
code and learning how to work with
devices really all came together in a
way that I never imagined the next thing
I pursued was actually working on
Holograms does anyone know what a
hologram is yeah you've only seen them
in movies right well when I was working
I actually got to bring Holograms into
my real world and see them every day and
we use them to plan different spaces so
for example if you were building a new
house you know where does the kitchen go
where does the fridge go where's the
couch go normally you'd actually have to
move all those things in and then spend
hours moving them around but with
Holograms you could simply pinch drag
make it larger and make it smaller and
it's a hundred percent recyclable so it
was really exciting for me to find new
and innovative ways to use technology
and I always wanted more and more and
more but today I work at Facebook and
I'm sure you guys are pretty familiar
with Facebook and what we do bringing
the world together helping people stay
connected and at at Facebook I worked on
a product called portal and portal is a
video communication device that allows
you to connect with loved ones in a real
way
so I'll give you an example of kind of
one of the things that sets portal apart
that really made it special for me to
work on so if you're a kid and that's a
flexible definition if your kid take
your hands and put them on the side of
your face kind of like blocking the side
yeah perfect
now just keep looking straight ahead and
if you're an adult I wanted to make a

front of your belly
okay now kids who have their their their
blinders up can you see can you see what
the parent next to you is doing no it's
it's tough to see because you have what

what portal does is it takes like the
traditional video communication that
you're used to and it opens it up to a
hundred and forty degrees you can
actually see the entire space not only
that it actually follows you around so
that you know you can move effortlessly
but instead of talking about this tech

can you go to the other side of the room
sure

I'm at home using my portal we you know

thanks so much for being here with us
today mom enjoy your breakfast so not

I love that I can combine that love of

but outside of work I have a lot of

chatting with my mom on portal or
programming this robot I'm the founder

Works
Eden Body Works was a company I started
when I was only 13 years old so who in
here is 13 years old or below yeah all
of you guys could be CEO all of you
girls could be CEOs of your own
companies starting today it was about 15
years ago that I came to NYU for my
first time at a summer camp hosted by
the network for teaching
entrepreneurship and they taught me all
about how do you start
business how do you see a need in the
world and come up with a solution to
solve a problem for me at 11 years old I
lost almost all of my hair due to a
chemical relaxer so I was basically bald
at 11 and this was after years of being
a child model and being in different
pageants and things like that so how I
looked really really mattered to me and
when I lost my hair I went to what I
knew from from being in school I use a
scientific method to come up with lots
of different natural formulas using oils
and herbs and spices to come up with a
hair oil as you can see me making there
to help regrow my hair and I think my
hair looks pretty great
but yeah so over over the years I've
worked with different men and women in
different countries around the world
I've learned about interesting
ingredients from all around the world
and now my company has almost 50
products unless we have 50 products that
are sold nationwide and in many
different countries at stores like
Walmart Walgreens CVS Target and this
all started as a project in my kitchen
as a 13 year old my parents out shout
out to all the parents in the house my
parents really supported me and really
encouraged me that I could be the
scientist I could be this engineer but
also that I can be a leader and a
communicator and a visionary and someone
who's really concerned about making the
world better for other people so these
are my cool jobs is what I do and I
absolutely love it so if you're out
there and you have a dream or you have a
business you want to get started or you
have a completely crazy weird career
path that you want to pursue I'm here to
tell you you should go do it thank you
so much for your time have a good day
